item.title: Notes: Lungeanu & Contractor. (2015). The effects of diversity and network ties on innovations
item.description: References Citekey: @Lungeanu2015-mb Lungeanu, A., & Contractor, N. S. (2015). The effects of diversity and network ties on innovations: The emergence of a new scientific field. The American Behavioral Scientist, 59(5), 548â€“564. https://doi.org/10.1177/0002764214556804 Notes Summarize: Very interesting study investigating factors impacting (reflected in) coauthorship relations in a new field. SIENA was used for the modeling of network dynamics. Key finding: Taken together with net findings about cognitive dissimilarity, this study suggests that innovation in networked research is most likely when teams draw on individuals with diverse knowledge resources, but who also have prior collaborations with each other or with common others.
